history.proof: intros H1 H2. apply in_rem_iff. split. - apply H2. - apply dec_DN. + shelve. + shelve.

exceptions.tactic: intros X y x A H1 H2.

exceptions.exn: Unable to find an instance for the variable y.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: eqType
y: eqType_X X
x: eqType_X X
A: list X

Goal:
x <> y -> x el A -> x el rem A y

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Record eqType : Type := EqType { eqType_X : Type; eqType_dec : eq_dec eqType_X } Arguments EqType X%type_scope {eqType_dec}%function_scope : rename
rem = fun A x => filter (fun z : X => Dec (z <> x)) A : list X -> X -> list X Arguments rem _%list_scope
eqType_X = fun e : eqType => let (eqType_X, _) := e in eqType_X : eqType -> Type eqType_X is a coercion
rem_in : forall x y A, x el rem A y -> x el A
rem_cons' : forall A B x y, x el B -> rem A y <<= B -> rem (x :: A) y <<= B
in_rem_iff : forall x A y, x el rem A y < -> x el A /\ x <> y
rem_not_in : forall x y A, x = y \/ ~ x el A -> ~ x el rem A y
in_cons_neq : forall (X : Type) (x y : X) (A : list X), x el y :: A -> x <> y -> x el A
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, a el ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : eqType x : X y : X A : list X |- Type] ?B : [X : eqType x : X y : X A : list X |- Type] ?f : [X : eqType x : X y : X A : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : eqType x : X y : X A : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : eqType x : X y : X A : list X |- list ?A]
not_in_cons : forall (X : Type) (x y : X) (A : list X), ~ x el y :: A -> x <> y /\ ~ x el A
in_in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x <> y -> x el l -> x el remove eq_dec y l
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
rem_mono : forall A B x, A <<= B -> rem A x <<= rem B x
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
ForallOrdPairs_In : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (l : list A), ForallOrdPairs R l -> forall x y : A, x el l -> y el l -> x = y \/ R x y \/ R y x
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
list_cc : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop) (A : list X), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> (exists x : X, x el A /\ p x) -> {x : X | x el A /\ p x}
in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x el remove eq_dec y l -> x el l /\ x <> y
filter_id : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> bool) (A : list X), (forall x : X, x el A -> p x) -> filter p A = A
cfind : forall (A0 : list ?X) (p : ?X -> Prop), (forall x : ?X, dec (p x)) -> {x0 : ?X | x0 el A0 /\ p x0} + {forall x0 : ?X, x0 el A0 -> ~ p x0} where ?X : [X : eqType x : X y : X A : list X |- Type]
list_exists_DM : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> ~ (forall x : X, x el A -> ~ p x) -> exists x : X, x el A /\ p x
filter_pq_eq : forall (X : Type) (p q : X -> bool) (A : list X), (forall x : X, x el A -> p x = q x) -> filter p A = filter q A
list_forall_dec : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> dec (forall x : X, x el A -> p x)
in_filter_iff : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (p : X -> bool) (A : list X), x el filter p A < -> x el A /\ p x
rem_cons : forall A B x, A <<= B -> rem (x :: A) x <<= B
in_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (a : A) (l : list A), {a el l} + {~ a el l}
notin_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x : A), ~ x el l -> remove eq_dec x l = l
NoDup_count_occ' : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A), NoDup l < -> (forall x : A, x el l -> count_occ decA l x = 1)
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el map f l < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ x el l)
in_flat_map_Exists : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), x el flat_map f l < -> Exists (fun y : A => x el f y) l
in_elt_inv : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), x el l1 ++ y :: l2 -> x = y \/ x el l1 ++ l2
remove_length_lt : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x : A), x el l -> | remove eq_dec x l | < | l |
incl_lrcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), x :: A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
equi : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop
disjoint : forall X : Type, list X -> list X -> Prop
notin_flat_map_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), ~ x el flat_map f l < -> Forall (fun y : A => ~ x el f y) l
Pos.le = fun x y : positive => (x ?= y)%positive <> Gt : positive -> positive -> Prop Arguments Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
incl_rcons : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A B : list X), A <<= x :: B -> ~ x el A -> A <<= B
rem_incl : forall A x, rem A x <<= A
find_none : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), find f l = None -> forall x : A, x el l -> f x = false
equi_push : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (A : list X), x el A -> A === x :: A
disjoint_forall : forall (X : Type) (A B : list X), disjoint A B < -> (forall x : X, x el A -> ~ x el B)
inclp : forall X : Type, list X -> (X -> Prop) -> Prop

```intros X y x A H1 H2. intros H3 H4. apply rem_in. apply in_rem_iff. split.
- apply H2.
- apply H3.```
